intro: Chirita zeylanica var. angusta, commonly known as narrow-leaved chirita, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a houseplant in many parts of the world.
